name: Aquarius
backgroundOrigin: The Water Bearer. Represents Ganymede, cup-bearer to the gods.
asterism: A "Y" shape (the Water Jar) flowing into faint lines.
majorStars: α (Sadalmelik), β (Sadalsuud), γ (Sadachbia), δ (Skat), ε (Albali), ζ, η, θ (Ancha), λ (Hydor)

name: Aries
backgroundOrigin: The Ram. The Golden Fleece sought by Jason and the Argonauts.
asterism: A simple crooked line of 3 stars.
majorStars: α (Hamal), β (Sheratan), γ (Mesarthim), δ (Botein), ε, 41 Arietis

name: Cancer
backgroundOrigin: The Crab. Sent by Hera to distract Hercules; crushed by his foot.
asterism: An upside-down "Y" (very faint). Look for the "Beehive Cluster" in center.
majorStars: α (Acubens), β (Tarf), γ (Asellus Borealis), δ (Asellus Australis), ι

name: Capricornus
backgroundOrigin: The Sea Goat. Represents the god Pan (goat head, fish tail).
asterism: A large, triangular "bikini bottom" or wedge shape.
majorStars: α (Algedi), β (Dabih), γ (Nashira), δ (Deneb Algedi), ζ, ω, ψ

name: Gemini
backgroundOrigin: The Twins. Castor and Pollux, inseparable brothers.
asterism: Two parallel stick figures joined at the top (The Twins).
majorStars: α (Castor), β (Pollux), γ (Alhena), δ (Wasat), ε (Mebsuta), ζ (Mekbuda), η (Propus), μ (Tejat)

name: Leo
backgroundOrigin: The Lion. The Nemean Lion slain by Hercules (his first labor).
asterism: A "Sickle" (backward question mark) head and a triangle body.
majorStars: α (Regulus), β (Denebola), γ (Algieba), δ (Zosma), ε (Rasalas), ζ (Adhafera), θ (Chertan), η, ο (Subra)

name: Libra
backgroundOrigin: The Scales. The scales of justice held by Virgo.
asterism: A diamond or box shape (formerly Scorpion's claws).
majorStars: α (Zubenelgenubi), β (Zubeneschamali), γ (Zubenelhakrabi), σ (Brachium), τ, υ

name: Pisces
backgroundOrigin: The Fish. Aphrodite and Eros transformed into fish to escape Typhon.
asterism: A "V" shape connecting two circles (the fish).
majorStars: α (Alrescha), β (Fumalsamakah), γ, δ, ε, ζ, η (Alpherg), ω, ι

name: Sagittarius
backgroundOrigin: The Archer. A centaur aiming his bow at the Scorpion.
asterism: The "Teapot" asterism (spout, lid, and handle).
majorStars: α (Rukbat), β (Arkab), γ (Alnasl), δ (Kaus Media), ε (Kaus Australis), ζ (Ascella), λ (Kaus Borealis), σ (Nunki)

name: Scorpius
backgroundOrigin: The Scorpion. Sent by Gaia to kill the hunter Orion.
asterism: A large "J" or hook shape; looks exactly like a scorpion.
majorStars: α (Antares), β (Acrab), δ (Dschubba), ε (Larawag), θ (Sargas), ι, κ (Girtab), λ (Shaula), υ (Lesath)

name: Taurus
backgroundOrigin: The Bull. Zeus disguised as a bull to abduct Europa.
asterism: A "V" shape (Hyades cluster) and the Pleiades cluster nearby.
majorStars: α (Aldebaran), β (Elnath), γ (Prima Hyadum), ε (Ain), ζ (Tianguan), η (Alcyone), Pleiades Cluster

name: Virgo
backgroundOrigin: The Virgin. Represents Justice (Dike) or Harvest (Demeter).
asterism: A "Y" shape or a reclining figure holding a stalk of wheat.
majorStars: α (Spica), β (Zavijava), γ (Porrima), δ (Auva), ε (Vindemiatrix), ζ (Heze), η (Zaniah), ι (Syrma)

name: Boötes
backgroundOrigin: The Herdsman. The bear driver chasing Ursa Major.
asterism: A giant Kite or Ice Cream Cone shape.
majorStars: α (Arcturus), β (Nekkar), γ (Seginus), δ, ε (Izar), η (Muphrid), ρ, ζ

name: Camelopardalis
backgroundOrigin: The Giraffe. Created to fill the gap between Auriga and the Bears.
asterism: Large but very faint sprawling zig-zag.
majorStars: α, β, 7 Cam, BK Cam, BE Cam (Very faint, no named stars)

name: Canes Venatici
backgroundOrigin: The Hunting Dogs. The dogs held on a leash by Boötes.
asterism: A simple line of two bright stars under the Big Dipper handle.
majorStars: α (Cor Caroli), β (Chara)

name: Coma Berenices
backgroundOrigin: Berenice's Hair. Queen Berenice II's sacrificed hair.
asterism: A right-angle hook; looks like a shimmering cluster of faint stars.
majorStars: α (Diadem), β, γ
source: Tycho Brahe (Ancient asterism, formalized by Brahe)

name: Corona Borealis
backgroundOrigin: The Northern Crown. The crown of Princess Ariadne.
asterism: A distinct "C" or bowl shape (The Crown).
majorStars: α (Alphecca), β (Nusakan), γ, δ, ε, θ, ι

name: Draco
backgroundOrigin: The Dragon. Guarded the golden apples of the Hesperides.
asterism: A long snake winding between the Bears; ends in a "Lozenge" head.
majorStars: α (Thuban), β (Rastaban), γ (Eltanin), δ (Altais), ζ (Aldhibah), η (Aldhibain), ι (Edasich)

name: Leo Minor
backgroundOrigin: The Little Lion. Created by Hevelius to neighbor Leo.
asterism: A faint, flat triangle between Leo and Ursa Major.
majorStars: 46 Leonis Minoris (Praecipua), β, 21 LMi

name: Lynx
backgroundOrigin: The Lynx. Faint stars requiring "lynx-like" eyes to see.
asterism: A faint, zig-zag line. Hard to see.
majorStars: α, 38 Lyncis (Maculosa), 31 Lyncis (Alsciaukat)

name: Ursa Major
backgroundOrigin: The Great Bear. Callisto, the nymph turned into a bear.
asterism: Contains the "Big Dipper" (Plough) asterism.
majorStars: α (Dubhe), β (Merak), γ (Phecda), δ (Megrez), ε (Alioth), ζ (Mizar), η (Alkaid), 80 UMa (Alcor)

name: Ursa Minor
backgroundOrigin: The Little Bear. Arcas, son of Callisto. Contains Polaris.
asterism: The "Little Dipper" (fainter, curved handle).
majorStars: α (Polaris), β (Kochab), γ (Pherkad), δ (Yildun), ε, ζ, η

name: Andromeda
backgroundOrigin: The Chained Princess. Saved from the sea monster by Perseus.
asterism: A V-shape or line extending from the Great Square of Pegasus.
majorStars: α (Alpheratz), β (Mirach), γ (Almach), δ, 51 And, μ, ν

name: Auriga
backgroundOrigin: The Charioteer. The inventor of the four-horse chariot.
asterism: An irregular pentagon (diamond shape).
majorStars: α (Capella), β (Menkalinan), θ (Mahasim), ι (Hassaleh), ε (Almaaz), ζ (Saclateni), η (Haedus)

name: Cassiopeia
backgroundOrigin: The Queen. Vain mother of Andromeda; sits upside down.
asterism: A distinct "W" or "M" shape (depending on orientation).
majorStars: α (Schedar), β (Caph), γ (Navi), δ (Ruchbah), ε (Segin), η (Achird)

name: Cepheus
backgroundOrigin: The King. Husband of Cassiopeia, King of Ethiopia.
asterism: A house shape (square with a triangle roof).
majorStars: α (Alderamin), β (Alfirk), γ (Errai), ζ, ι, μ (Garnet Star)

name: Cetus
backgroundOrigin: The Sea Monster. The beast sent to devour Andromeda.
asterism: A large whale body with a circle for the head (the Monster's Maw).
majorStars: α (Menkar), β (Diphda), γ (Kaffaljidhma), ζ (Baten Kaitos), τ, ο (Mira)

name: Lacerta
backgroundOrigin: The Lizard. A modern constellation filling a gap in the sky.
asterism: A zig-zag "W" shape (often called Little Cassiopeia).
majorStars: α, β, 1 through 6 Lacertae

name: Pegasus
backgroundOrigin: The Winged Horse. Sprang from Medusa's neck.
asterism: The "Great Square" (a large, empty box of stars).
majorStars: α (Markab), β (Scheat), γ (Algenib), ε (Enif), ζ (Homam), η (Matar), θ (Biham), μ (Sadalbari)

name: Perseus
backgroundOrigin: The Hero. Slayer of Medusa and savior of Andromeda.
asterism: A wishbone or forked line of stars.
majorStars: α (Mirfak), β (Algol), ζ (Atik), ε, δ, γ, ρ (Gorgonea Tertia)

name: Triangulum
backgroundOrigin: The Triangle. Represents the Greek letter Delta.
asterism: A long, narrow triangle.
majorStars: α (Mothallah), β (Deltoton), γ

name: Aquila
backgroundOrigin: The Eagle. Carried Zeus's thunderbolts.
asterism: A diamond or flying bird shape along the Milky Way.
majorStars: α (Altair), β (Alshain), γ (Tarazed), δ, ε, ζ (Okab), η, θ, λ (Al Thalimain)

name: Ara
backgroundOrigin: The Altar. Where the gods swore allegiance before the Titan war.
asterism: An "H" shape or twisted box beneath Scorpius.
majorStars: α, β, γ, δ, ζ, η, ε

name: Centaurus
backgroundOrigin: The Centaur. Chiron, the wise tutor of heroes.
asterism: Large, bright hexagon arching over the Southern Cross.
majorStars: α (Rigil Kentaurus), β (Hadar), θ (Menkent), γ (Muhlifain), ε, η, ζ

name: Corona Australis
backgroundOrigin: The Southern Crown. A wreath associated with the Centaur.
asterism: An arc or semi-circle of stars (The Wreath).
majorStars: α (Meridiana), β, γ, δ, ε

name: Corvus
backgroundOrigin: The Crow. Apollo's bird, punished for laziness.
asterism: A distinct trapezoid (The Sail) appearing to "ride" Hydra.
majorStars: α (Alchiba), β (Kraz), γ (Gienah), δ (Algorab), ε (Minkar)

name: Crater
backgroundOrigin: The Cup. The cup of Apollo.
asterism: A faint cup or goblet shape.
majorStars: α (Alkes), β, γ, δ (Labrum), ε, ζ

name: Crux
backgroundOrigin: The Southern Cross. Vital navigational tool for finding South.
asterism: A tight, bright cross (The Southern Cross).
majorStars: α (Acrux), β (Mimosa), γ (Gacrux), δ (Imai), ε (Ginan)

name: Cygnus
backgroundOrigin: The Swan. Zeus in disguise; contains the Northern Cross.
asterism: A large cross (The Northern Cross) flying down the Milky Way.
majorStars: α (Deneb), β (Albireo), γ (Sadr), δ (Fawaris), ε (Aljanah), ζ, τ

name: Hercules
backgroundOrigin: The Hero. The strongest Greek hero, depicted kneeling.
asterism: A central "Keystone" (trapezoid) with limbs extending out.
majorStars: α (Rasalgethi), β (Kornephoros), ζ, δ (Sarin), π, η, ε, μ

name: Hydra
backgroundOrigin: The Water Snake. The multi-headed beast slain by Hercules.
asterism: A long, winding snake spanning 100 degrees of sky.
majorStars: α (Alphard), γ, ζ, ν, π, ε, xi, β

name: Lupus
backgroundOrigin: The Wolf. A beast being sacrificed by Centaurus.
asterism: A distinctive asterism of bright stars near Centaurus.
majorStars: α, β, γ, δ, ε, ζ, η, ι

name: Lyra
backgroundOrigin: The Lyre. The harp of Orpheus.
asterism: A small parallelogram attached to a bright star.
majorStars: α (Vega), β (Sheliak), γ (Sulafat), δ, ε (Double Double), ζ, η (Aladfar)

name: Ophiuchus
backgroundOrigin: The Serpent Bearer. Asclepius, the healer holding the snake.
asterism: A large, house-shaped bell curve holding the Serpent.
majorStars: α (Rasalhague), η (Sabik), ζ (Han), δ (Yed Prior), ε (Yed Posterior), β (Cebalrai), κ

name: Sagitta
backgroundOrigin: The Arrow. The arrow that killed the Eagle (Aquila).
asterism: A clear, small arrow shape.
majorStars: α (Sham), β, γ, δ

name: Scutum
backgroundOrigin: The Shield. Represents the shield of King Jan III Sobieski.
asterism: Small diamond shape in the Milky Way rift.
majorStars: α, β, γ, δ

name: Serpens
backgroundOrigin: The Serpent. The snake held by Ophiuchus (split into Head/Tail).
asterism: Two parts (Head and Tail) on either side of Ophiuchus.
majorStars: α (Unukalhai), η, μ, ξ, ε, δ, γ, θ (Alya)

name: Sextans
backgroundOrigin: The Sextant. An astronomical instrument.
asterism: Faint, irregular box.
majorStars: α, β, γ

name: Triangulum Aust.
backgroundOrigin: The Southern Triangle. A navigational triangle.
asterism: A distinct, bright equilateral triangle.
majorStars: α (Atria), β, γ
source: Petrus Plancius (Based on Keyser/de Houtman data)

name: Vulpecula
backgroundOrigin: The Fox. Originally "The Fox with the Goose."
asterism: Faint line; inside the Summer Triangle.
majorStars: α (Anser), 23 Vulpeculae, 13 Vulpeculae

name: Canis Major
backgroundOrigin: The Great Dog. Orion's hunting dog; contains Sirius.
asterism: A stick figure dog standing on hind legs.
majorStars: α (Sirius), ε (Adhara), δ (Wezen), β (Mirzam), η (Aludra), ζ (Furud), ο 1 & 2

name: Canis Minor
backgroundOrigin: The Little Dog. Orion's second hunting dog; contains Procyon.
asterism: A simple line of two stars.
majorStars: α (Procyon), β (Gomeisa)

name: Lepus
backgroundOrigin: The Hare. A rabbit chased by Orion's dogs.
asterism: An "H" or box shape under Orion's feet.
majorStars: α (Arneb), β (Nihal), γ, δ, ε, μ, ζ

name: Monoceros
backgroundOrigin: The Unicorn. A modern constellation near Orion.
asterism: Faint shape inside the "Winter Triangle" stars.
majorStars: α, β (Wonder Star), γ, δ

name: Orion
backgroundOrigin: The Hunter. The giant hunter slain by Scorpius.
asterism: Distinct hourglass; 3 Belt stars, sword hangs from belt.
majorStars: α (Betelgeuse), β (Rigel), γ (Bellatrix), δ (Mintaka), ε (Alnilam), ζ (Alnitak), κ (Saiph), λ (Meissa)

name: Carina
backgroundOrigin: The Keel. The hull of the ship Argo Navis.
asterism: The base of a ship; bright and dense.
majorStars: α (Canopus), β (Miaplacidus), ε (Avior), ι (Aspidiske), θ, υ, ω
source: Nicolas Louis de Lacaille (Split ancient Argo Navis)

name: Columba
backgroundOrigin: The Dove. The bird Noah sent from the Ark.
asterism: A crooked line or small quadrilateral south of Orion.
majorStars: α (Phact), β (Wazn), γ, δ

name: Delphinus
backgroundOrigin: The Dolphin. Messenger of Poseidon.
asterism: A small, distinct diamond with a tail (The Job's Coffin).
majorStars: α (Sualocin), β (Rotanev), γ, δ, ε (Deneb Dulfim)

name: Equuleus
backgroundOrigin: The Little Horse. Brother of Pegasus.
asterism: A faint, small trapezoid near Pegasus.
majorStars: α (Kitalpha), β, γ, δ

name: Eridanus
backgroundOrigin: The River. The celestial river Phaethon fell into.
asterism: A long, winding river of stars starting at Orion's foot.
majorStars: α (Achernar), β (Cursa), γ (Zaurak), δ (Rana), ε (Sadira), θ (Acamar)

name: Piscis Austrinus
backgroundOrigin: The Southern Fish. Drinks water from Aquarius's jar.
asterism: A flattened oval or loop.
majorStars: α (Fomalhaut), β, γ, δ, ε

name: Puppis
backgroundOrigin: The Stern. The back deck of the ship Argo Navis.
asterism: Dense collection of bright stars (the Ship's Deck).
majorStars: ζ (Naos), π (Ahadi), ρ (Tureis), τ, ν, σ, ξ (Azmidi)
source: Nicolas Louis de Lacaille (Split ancient Argo Navis)

name: Pyxis
backgroundOrigin: The Compass. The mariner's compass of Argo Navis.
asterism: A faint line of three stars.
majorStars: α, β, γ
source: Nicolas Louis de Lacaille (Added to Argo Navis split)

name: Vela
backgroundOrigin: The Sails. The sails of the ship Argo Navis.
asterism: A complex ring or cross of stars (The False Cross).
majorStars: γ (Regor), δ (Alsephina), λ (Suhail), κ (Markeb), μ, φ, ψ
source: Nicolas Louis de Lacaille (Split ancient Argo Navis)

name: Apus
backgroundOrigin: The Bird of Paradise. Exotic bird from the East Indies.
asterism: Faint triangle near the South Pole.
majorStars: α, β, γ, δ
source: Keyser & de Houtman (First published by Bayer 1603)

name: Chamaeleon
backgroundOrigin: The Chameleon. Small lizard-like constellation.
asterism: Small diamond shape near the South Celestial Pole.
majorStars: α, β, γ, δ
source: Keyser & de Houtman (First published by Bayer 1603)

name: Dorado
backgroundOrigin: The Dolphinfish. Represents the mahi-mahi.
asterism: A faint vertical line; look for the Large Magellanic Cloud nearby.
majorStars: α, β, γ, δ
source: Keyser & de Houtman (First published by Bayer 1603)

name: Grus
backgroundOrigin: The Crane. Formerly part of the Southern Fish.
asterism: A distinct, bright bird-like cross.
majorStars: α (Alnair), β (Tiaki), γ (Aldhanab), δ, ε, ζ
source: Keyser & de Houtman (First published by Bayer 1603)

name: Hydrus
backgroundOrigin: The Male Water Snake. Southern counterpart to Hydra.
asterism: A triangle near the Magellanic Clouds.
majorStars: α, β, γ
source: Keyser & de Houtman (First published by Bayer 1603)

name: Indus
backgroundOrigin: The Indian. Represents indigenous peoples of the new world.
asterism: A faint triangle or bent line.
majorStars: α (The Persian), β, ε
source: Keyser & de Houtman (First published by Bayer 1603)

name: Musca
backgroundOrigin: The Fly. Originally "The Bee."
asterism: A clear trapezoid south of the Southern Cross.
majorStars: α, β, γ, δ
source: Keyser & de Houtman (First published by Bayer 1603)

name: Pavo
backgroundOrigin: The Peacock. Sacred bird of Hera.
asterism: A "saucepan" shape (similar to Big Dipper but southern).
majorStars: α (Peacock), β, δ, η, ε
source: Keyser & de Houtman (First published by Bayer 1603)

name: Phoenix
backgroundOrigin: The Phoenix. Mythical bird reborn from ashes.
asterism: A tilted boat or irregular triangle shape.
majorStars: α (Ankaa), β, γ, ε, δ, ζ
source: Keyser & de Houtman (First published by Bayer 1603)

name: Tucana
backgroundOrigin: The Toucan. Exotic bird; contains Small Magellanic Cloud.
asterism: A kite shape; home to the star cluster 47 Tucanae.
majorStars: α, γ, ζ, β
source: Keyser & de Houtman (First published by Bayer 1603)

name: Volans
backgroundOrigin: The Flying Fish. Fish seen jumping from the ocean.
asterism: An irregular trapezoid or kite.
majorStars: β, γ, ζ, δ, α, ε
source: Keyser & de Houtman (First published by Bayer 1603)

name: Antlia
backgroundOrigin: The Air Pump. Honors the invention of the air pump.
asterism: Very faint; irregular pattern. Hard to spot.
majorStars: α, ε, ι, θ

name: Caelum
backgroundOrigin: The Chisel. Sculptor's engraving tool.
asterism: Faint line; no distinct shape.
majorStars: α, γ, β

name: Circinus
backgroundOrigin: The Compass. Drafting tool for drawing circles.
asterism: A narrow triangle pointing toward Alpha Centauri.
majorStars: α, β, γ

name: Fornax
backgroundOrigin: The Furnace. The chemist's distillation furnace.
asterism: Faint, amorphous shape.
majorStars: α (Dalim), β

name: Horologium
backgroundOrigin: The Clock. Honors the pendulum clock invention.
asterism: Very faint, bent line.
majorStars: α, δ, β

name: Mensa
backgroundOrigin: Table Mountain. Named after the mountain in South Africa.
asterism: The faintest constellation; difficult to see even in dark skies.
majorStars: α, γ, β (Very faint)

name: Microscopium
backgroundOrigin: The Microscope. Honors the invention of the microscope.
asterism: Faint; no distinct shape.
majorStars: γ, ε, α

name: Norma
backgroundOrigin: The Carpenter's Square. A level and square tool.
asterism: Faint box shape in the Milky Way.
majorStars: γ2, η, ε

name: Octans
backgroundOrigin: The Octant. Navigational instrument; contains South Pole.
asterism: Faint triangle; marks the South Celestial Pole (no bright pole star).
majorStars: ν, β, δ, θ, σ (Polaris Australis)

name: Pictor
backgroundOrigin: The Easel. The painter's easel.
asterism: Faint; located near the bright star Canopus.
majorStars: α, β, γ

name: Reticulum
backgroundOrigin: The Reticle. Crosshairs in a telescope eyepiece.
asterism: A distinct, small diamond shape.
majorStars: α, β, ε, γ, δ

name: Sculptor
backgroundOrigin: The Sculptor. Represents a sculptor's studio.
asterism: Faint; contains the South Galactic Pole.
majorStars: α, β, γ, δ

name: Telescopium
backgroundOrigin: The Telescope. Honors the invention of the telescope.
asterism: Faint stars forming a corner shape.
majorStars: α, ζ, ε
